author: Lyman Tsang
comment: So I was reading the help site and it mentioned a WiFi trigger. I didn't see it in the app but thought paying for the Unlock Features would enable it. Not only did the IAP not enable that feature, it didn't seem to enable anything. I tried asking for a refund but never got a response.  The Profiles are also a little clunky. I wish they had the option of only setting specific categories. I never really want my Media volume set to something specific. I just want it what I have it set to last.   I do like that it allows me to separate my Ringer and Notification volumes on my Pixel XL without root.

author: Jim Michelotti
comment: I purchased this app to separate the notification and ringer volumes. Free version doesn't have this. Paid the $3.99 and it didn't appear to have added this feature. After hacking through the options, it seems that it may have added it.  Very confusing layout and not sure how to set it up.  I would choose another app for addressing something as important as ensuring that you don't miss phone calls. ... After further use I figured out how it works.  My I comments were due to Operator Error (me).  It's a pretty good app.  A few small enhancements, however,I would it much easier to configure and view current settings.

author: Gerald Arndt
comment: Would only show Permissions screen.  No way to get passed that.  Probably need to give it more permissions then it needs.  If that's the case, what's the point of letting me choose in the first place?

author: Jacqueline Harper
comment: One of my schedules triggers a Profile at random times of the day. How do i fix this.

author: G Fyrhthe
comment: Couldn't get past the first window telling me it needs permissions, but doesn't say what.

author: Niko Winarta
comment: The Wear app is back!

author: makpel talukder
comment: It's great

author: M.L. Smith
comment: Stopped working reliably with new version. Used to like it a lot.

author: Tony Maratta
comment: Thank you for fixing the notification bug, but there is still an Android Notification related to your app that is stuck in the tray. Can't seem to remove it.

author: Dave Yount
comment: Update in the last few days resulted in "Start With" feature no longer working.  Not even an option on the settings menu.

author: Christian Zandstra
comment: Schedules are not working anymore!

author: Robert Schneider
comment: It resets to the same profile when not moving even if the location hasn't changed and this messes with media volume. I can't find a way to tell it not to mess with media volume. Or if the location hasn't changed it shouldn't keep applying the same profile that is already being applied. Very annoying fighting it while listening to music. Also this could be fixed with just having the ability to exclude changing specific volumes in profiles.

author: Beth Jameson
comment: Basically useless in free version (same as any other volume app) and immediately asks for payment to do anything more. Will not separate volume for notifications from ringer

author: Chris Kelly
comment: Please add Bluetooth support for profiles.  Connecting to different bluetooth devices to set profiles for cars, headphones, etc.  Location based profiles are not working correctly and keeping address settings now.  PIXEL XL.

author: Darryl Hylton
comment: Sometimes the profile settings don't seem to work, e.g. notifications. (Paid version on GS7).

author: Mark Ebersole
comment: Keeps the cat in check.
title: Great when my cat keeps trying to turn my volume too low.

author: Alan D.
comment: Great little app, but I cannot seem to be able to control the volume of the click when tapping on screen...

author: Benny Nielsen
comment: Not possible to Separate Ringer and Notification volumes as stated

author: Balaji G
comment: If device support then only RingVolume ans Notification Volume is separated

author: Lonnie V
comment: Doesn't work on Google pixel don't waste your time

author: Curtis Sylvester Jr.
comment: The app is listed as free in the store, yet i try to use this and it wants me to pay. IT'S NOT FREE THEN NOW IS IT???
title: UNINSTALLING

author: Jacky Chiew
comment: Latest update huge size reduction? Man, you just enlarged it and make it looks more uglier than before.
title: Ugly Widget

author: Tim Moriarty
comment: Could use better documentation

author: Autumn Nellany
comment: I've jumped through way too many hoops with this damn app. I have to mess with the settings just to split ringer and notification volume when this should be the apps default state, but no matter what I do the two are always the same volume. Putting ringer at 5 causes notification volume to jump 5. I just want to split the two ffs!
title: Lies

author: Kenny Ng
comment: This app was working great until I upgraded to LP. VB is unable to modify the ringer volume. I already fiddle with the Advance setting but none of the combination help this matter. I hope this can be fix soon.
title: Cannot control LG G3 ringer in LP

author: Joe Supererogatory
comment: I make a profile and set a schedule, but it won't lock. I can change the volume at will - it's  just as if this app isn't there - uninstall :-(
title: Won't lock

author: Matt Hengey
comment: Has a lot of promise but does not execute. Purchased expansion packs and it crashes every time I use them. Dev has not responded to any of my emails.

author: M. Bison
comment: Like the title says, this app is very different from the apps I've tried in regard to controlling your volumes through an application. It's the customizing options I like most about Volume Butler. I've been using this app for approx. a couple of years and it fits my needs.
title: A very unique volume controller

author: Dan Neagu
comment: Separate volumes are available! Search and read the instructions on dev website. App works as intended. It would be usefull to know what are the benefits of pro version.

author: Brixter Tabun
comment: I downloaded it because of this. Now I can't use it any more for this.

reply.author: TUOGOL
reply.content: To separate the notification and ring volumes go to Volume Butler Settings and check the box.

title: Notifications is not separate anymore

author: Niklas Weins
comment: Unfortunately does not have separate function anymore

reply.author: TUOGOL
reply.content: Separate ringer and notification volumes can be enabled in Settings.

author: Anatoly Cherenkov
comment: Will give 5 stars if implemented
title: No separate ring and notifications volume

author: Patrick P
comment: I've used this since I first got my nexus 6 and it worked fine separating ring tone and notifications for awhile. The last few updates have caused that to fail. It's like they are merged again even though there is still an option to split them. Uninstalling

reply.author: TUOGOL
reply.content: To separate the notification and ring volumes go to Volume Butler Settings and check the box.

title: Good to worse

author: Christopher Meacham
comment: The author of the app did not make it readily apparent that this app is not the full version. After working so much to add profiles and then find out that I am only allowed one location until I pay $50, it leaves a bad first impression. Be ready to pay if you end up liking it.

reply.author: TUOGOL
reply.content: Hi Christopher, Volume Butler is currently $4 not $50.

title: I didn't get far enough to even use it.

author: Darren Carnall
comment: I got this when my Moto X was on lollipop, and it seemed to work separating my ringer and notifications, but since upgrading to Marshmallow I've just found that by silencing my notifications it also silences my ring. Even though the app widget tells me there should be volume, when I go into my settings the ring is on silent. Will have to uninstall until this is fixed. App is great otherwise.
title: Marshmallow

author: Evgeny Volovich
comment: Used to be OK, though the interface was and remains confusing. The latest update sucks.  The latest update destroyed the 4x1 widget. It used to be easy to see which profile was enabled, now I can't see it at all. Also, when swithching profiles it now changes the ringtone on the first SIM to default. Yes, I know I can specify the right ringtone in each profile, but this is a very poor solution, because every time I decide to change the ringtone I will have to remember to change Volume Butler settings. This didn't use to be an issue. One way to fix it would be to use a setting that does not affect the choice of a ringtone in any way.

author: Kimberly Skertchly
comment: It was great but it doesn't work properly after the last update. Widget icons are now bunched up and profile marker no longer exists.

reply.author: TUOGOL
reply.content: We've added back the profile indicator, try resizing your widget to fix the icons.

title: It was great

author: Peter B
comment: Totally illogical system, if you want to set notification sounds in it.  And overall too.  Disappointed,  even though i paid to buy the unlock,  but after s week i had enough
title: Pissing me off

author: Chris Dart
comment: Has been greatly improved recently. Active profile marker on the widget bar has disappeared which is a pity.

reply.author: TUOGOL
reply.content: Added back the active profile indicator and added a 6th profile to this widget in the latest update.

title: Now does a good job.

author: Atsawin Chaowanakritsanakul
comment: Can't separate notification and ring.

reply.author: TUOGOL
reply.content: To separate the notification and ring volumes go to Volume Butler Settings and check the box.
